## Checklist

<!-- Ensure all items are checked before requesting review -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have run the linter and fixed all issues (`make lint`)
- [ ] I have formatted my code (`make format`)

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes (`make test`)
- [ ] I have checked code coverage and it meets the project standards

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the README if needed
- [ ] I have added/updated docstrings for new functions/classes
- [ ] I have updated API documentation if endpoints changed

### Security

- [ ] I have not committed any secrets or sensitive data
- [ ] I have validated all user inputs
- [ ] I have considered security implications of my changes
- [ ] I have run security checks (`make security`)

### Database

- [ ] I have created/updated database migrations if needed
- [ ] Migrations are reversible (have a downgrade path)
- [ ] I have tested migrations on a clean database

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have kept dependency changes to a minimum
- [ ] I have checked for security vulnerabilities in new dependencies
- [ ] I have updated requirements.txt or package.json if needed
- [ ] All dependency licenses are compatible with the project

## Deployment Considerations

<!-- Note any special deployment requirements or considerations -->

- [ ] Requires environment variable changes
- [ ] Requires database migration
- [ ] Requires configuration updates
- [ ] Requires cache invalidation
- [ ] Backward compatible with current production

## Reviewer Checklist

<!-- For reviewers - do not edit -->

- [ ] Code follows project conventions
- [ ] Tests are adequate and pass
- [ ] Documentation is clear and complete
- [ ] No security concerns
- [ ] Performance is acceptable
- [ ] No breaking changes (or properly documented if unavoidable)
